Dictionary.Name: The Collaborative International Dictionary of English v.0.44

Definition.WordDefinition:
Prying \Pry"ing\, a. Inspecting closely or impertinently. [1913 Webster]
Syn: Inquisitive; curious. See {Inquisitive}. [1913 Webster]

Dictionary.Name: The Collaborative International Dictionary of English v.0.44

Definition.WordDefinition: Pry \Pry\, v. t. [imp. & p. p. {Pried}; p. pr. & vb. n. {Prying}.] To raise or move, or attempt to raise or move, with a pry or lever; to prize. [Local, U. S. & Eng.] [1913 Webster]

prying adj : offensively curious or inquisitive; "curious about the neighbor's doings"; "he flipped through my letters in his nosy way"; "prying eyes"; "the snoopy neighbor watched us all day" [syn: {nosy}, {nosey}, {snoopy}] n : offensive inquisitiveness [syn: {nosiness}, {snoopiness}]
